intro: Forsteronia guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana forsteria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Forsteronia guyanensis is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
